adjective.description: Accompanying but not a major part of something.
examples: for the fieldworker who deals with real problems, paperwork is incidental

adjective.description: Liable to happen as a consequence of (an activity)
examples: the ordinary risks incidental to a fireman's job

noun.description: An incidental detail, expense, event, etc.
examples: an allowance to cover meals, taxis, and other incidentals

origin: Early 17th century: originally from medieval Latin incidentalis, from Latin incident- falling upon, happening to (from the verb incidere).
